required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 Imaging and Cardiotoxicity in Patients With Early Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 Imaging of Apoptosis and Cardiotoxicity in Relationship to Ventricular Function in Patients With Early Stage Breast Cancer Receiving Doxorubicin-Based Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
This was a single center, proof-of-concept (PoC), Phase II study. Patients with histologically confirmed early stage (Stage I, II or III) HER-2 negative breast cancer and scheduled to receive doxorubicin-based (neo)adjuvant therapy to be followed by paclitaxel or docetaxel as per clinical practice. The planned doxorubicin-based chemotherapy treatment consisted of doxorubicin 60 mg/m2 in combination with cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m2 (AC) intravenous (IV) every 2 or 3 weeks for 4 cycles. Patients were scheduled for CMRI and 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 imaging (planar and SPECT / CT) at the following visits:
1. Screening/baseline, i.e. 2 weeks prior to initiating AC treatment (Visit 1)
2. After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of AC treatment (Visit 2)
3. After the 4th cycle of AC treatment and within 2 weeks (Visit 3)
4. At 12 weeks after the 4th cycle of AC treatment (Visit 4). The imaging procedures were conducted and analyzed. Bloodwork for cardiotoxicity biomarkers (troponin, N terminal pro B-type natriuretic peptide [NT-proBNP]) was performed at each visit.

detailed_description.textblock:
Overall, it was planned to recruit 30 adults with early stage breast cancer. The first 10 patients were to be enrolled in the PoC phase of the study to assess the potential of 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 in terms of imaging quality, uptake and medical relevance. Based on the results of the first 10 patients, the DMC was to decide whether to terminate the study or continue to the Phase II and enroll the next 20 planned patients. The maximum study duration was 26 (±4) weeks per patient (including the screening and follow-up periods).
The sponsor decided to terminate the study earlier than planned due to strategic decisions to focus the AAA development portfolio on oncology theragnostics and not based on safety concerns.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor Decision based on strategic considerations

primary_outcome.measure: Part I / Proof of Concept (PoC): Number of Participants Evaluated for Imaging Feasibility
primary_outcome.description: The feasibility of imaging apoptotic activity using 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was assessed in the first 10 patients who enrolled and completed the PoC phase of the study by the data monitoring committee (visual image review and consensus). The three reviewers of the DMC did an independent visual assessment of the images using a 1 to 4 point grading system: each observer reviewed the images of each patient and scored either 1 or 2 (uptake was less than or equal to blood pool), these images were considered normal; 3 was equivocal and four equalled abnormal. Only descriptive analysis performed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 and 120 minutes post injection at: Day 0 (Baseline), Visit 2 (After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of doxorubicin), Visit 3 (After the 4th cycle of doxorubicin and within 2 weeks), Visit 4 (12 weeks after the 4th cycle of doxorubicin)
secondary_outcome.description: Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)/Computed Tomography (CT) scans of the thorax were acquired with a dual head SPECT/CT gamma camera with low-energy high-resolution collimators at 1 and 2 hours post-injection at each collection time point and were to be compared to Baseline. Myocardial uptake was measured from regions of interest (ROIs) placed over the myocardium on the SPECT images coregistered with the corresponding CT images for anatomic delineation. Myocardial uptake was expressed either in absolute units (% injected dose/g) or as a standardized uptake value (SUV). Only descriptive analysis performed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Baseline), Visit 2 (After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of doxorubicin), Visit 3 (After the 4th cycle of doxorubicin and within 2 weeks), Visit 4 (12 weeks after the 4th cycle of doxorubicin)
secondary_outcome.description: The worsening of LV function was to be assessed by comparing cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMRI) left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) after the 2nd and the 4th cycle of doxorubicin/cyclophosphamide chemotherapy (AC) treatment and after 12 weeks of the last dose of doxorubicin compared to Baseline. Only descriptive analysis performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cardiotoxicity Biomarkers (Troponin and NT-proBNP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Baseline), Visit 2 (After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of doxorubicin), Visit 3 (After the 4th cycle of doxorubicin and within 2 weeks), Visit 4 (12 weeks after the 4th cycle of doxorubicin)
secondary_outcome.description: The differences of LV function after the 2nd and the 4th cycle of doxorubicin/cyclophosphamide chemotherapy (AC) treatment and after 12 weeks of the last dose of doxorubicin compared to Baseline were to be correlated with the changes in cardiotoxicity biomarkers: Troponin and N Terminal pro B-type Natriuretic Peptide (NT-proBNP). Only descriptive analysis performed.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with breast cancer receiving chemotherapy
arm_group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

intervention.description: Kit for the preparation of 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with breast cancer receiving chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Females >= 18 years of age with histologically confirmed early stage (Stage I, II or III) HER-2 negative breast cancer and planned for (neo)adjuvant doxorubicin-based chemotherapy (AC every 2 or 3 weeks x 4 cycles)
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Status (ECOG) ≤ 2
3. Able and willing to comply with the study procedures
Exclusion criteria:
1. Pregnancy or lactation
2. Moderate or severe valvular stenosis or regurgitation
3. History of atrial fibrillation or flutter
4. History of any disease or relevant physical or psychiatric condition which may interfere with the study objectives at the investigator judgment
5. Know hypersensitivity to the investigational product (IP) or any of its components
6. Prosthetic valve or pacemaker
7. Claustrophobia or inability to lie still in a supine position
8. Contraindication(s) to the CMRI procedure
9. Participation in another clinical trial within 4 weeks before study inclusion, except for patients who have participated or who are currently participating in a study without any study drug administration
10. Unwillingness to provide consent

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at single center in Canada.

group.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 (Part I / Proof of Concept)
group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

outcome.title: Part I / Proof of Concept (PoC): Number of Participants Evaluated for Imaging Feasibility
outcome.description: The feasibility of imaging apoptotic activity using 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was assessed in the first 10 patients who enrolled and completed the PoC phase of the study by the data monitoring committee (visual image review and consensus). The three reviewers of the DMC did an independent visual assessment of the images using a 1 to 4 point grading system: each observer reviewed the images of each patient and scored either 1 or 2 (uptake was less than or equal to blood pool), these images were considered normal; 3 was equivocal and four equalled abnormal. Only descriptive analysis performed.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). Only the first 10 participants who enrolled and completed the PoC phase of the study were included in the analysis.

group.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 (Part I / Proof of Concept)
group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

measure.title: Part I / Proof of Concept (PoC): Number of Participants Evaluated for Imaging Feasibility
measure.description: The feasibility of imaging apoptotic activity using 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was assessed in the first 10 patients who enrolled and completed the PoC phase of the study by the data monitoring committee (visual image review and consensus). The three reviewers of the DMC did an independent visual assessment of the images using a 1 to 4 point grading system: each observer reviewed the images of each patient and scored either 1 or 2 (uptake was less than or equal to blood pool), these images were considered normal; 3 was equivocal and four equalled abnormal. Only descriptive analysis performed.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). Only the first 10 participants who enrolled and completed the PoC phase of the study were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 Myocardial Uptake
outcome.description: Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)/Computed Tomography (CT) scans of the thorax were acquired with a dual head SPECT/CT gamma camera with low-energy high-resolution collimators at 1 and 2 hours post-injection at each collection time point and were to be compared to Baseline. Myocardial uptake was measured from regions of interest (ROIs) placed over the myocardium on the SPECT images coregistered with the corresponding CT images for anatomic delineation. Myocardial uptake was expressed either in absolute units (% injected dose/g) or as a standardized uptake value (SUV). Only descriptive analysis performed.
outcome.time_frame: 60 and 120 minutes post injection at: Day 0 (Baseline), Visit 2 (After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of doxorubicin), Visit 3 (After the 4th cycle of doxorubicin and within 2 weeks), Visit 4 (12 weeks after the 4th cycle of doxorubicin)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). Only the participants who completed the 4 chemotherapy treatment cycles and underwent all study visits were included in the analysis.

group.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 (Part I / Proof of Concept)
group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

group.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 (Part II / Phase II)
group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

measure.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 Myocardial Uptake
measure.description: Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)/Computed Tomography (CT) scans of the thorax were acquired with a dual head SPECT/CT gamma camera with low-energy high-resolution collimators at 1 and 2 hours post-injection at each collection time point and were to be compared to Baseline. Myocardial uptake was measured from regions of interest (ROIs) placed over the myocardium on the SPECT images coregistered with the corresponding CT images for anatomic delineation. Myocardial uptake was expressed either in absolute units (% injected dose/g) or as a standardized uptake value (SUV). Only descriptive analysis performed.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). Only the participants who completed the 4 chemotherapy treatment cycles and underwent all study visits were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Changes in Left Ventricular (LV) Function
outcome.description: The worsening of LV function was to be assessed by comparing cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMRI) left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) after the 2nd and the 4th cycle of doxorubicin/cyclophosphamide chemotherapy (AC) treatment and after 12 weeks of the last dose of doxorubicin compared to Baseline. Only descriptive analysis performed.
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Baseline), Visit 2 (After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of doxorubicin), Visit 3 (After the 4th cycle of doxorubicin and within 2 weeks), Visit 4 (12 weeks after the 4th cycle of doxorubicin)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). Only the participants who completed the 4 chemotherapy treatment cycles and underwent all study visits were included in the analysis.

group.title: 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 (Part I / Proof of Concept)
group.description: After reconstitution and radiolabeling, 99mTc-rhAnnexin V-128 was administered as a single intravenous bolus of 350 MBq +/- 10% at baseline, after the 2nd cycle, after the 4th cycle and 12 weeks after AC chemotherapy.

measure.title: Changes in Left Ventricular (LV) Function
measure.description: The worsening of LV function was to be assessed by comparing cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMRI) left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) after the 2nd and the 4th cycle of doxorubicin/cyclophosphamide chemotherapy (AC) treatment and after 12 weeks of the last dose of doxorubicin compared to Baseline. Only descriptive analysis performed.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). Only the participants who completed the 4 chemotherapy treatment cycles and underwent all study visits were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Changes in the Cardiotoxicity Biomarkers (Troponin and NT-proBNP)
outcome.description: The differences of LV function after the 2nd and the 4th cycle of doxorubicin/cyclophosphamide chemotherapy (AC) treatment and after 12 weeks of the last dose of doxorubicin compared to Baseline were to be correlated with the changes in cardiotoxicity biomarkers: Troponin and N Terminal pro B-type Natriuretic Peptide (NT-proBNP). Only descriptive analysis performed.
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Baseline), Visit 2 (After the 2nd and before the 3rd cycle of doxorubicin), Visit 3 (After the 4th cycle of doxorubicin and within 2 weeks), Visit 4 (12 weeks after the 4th cycle of doxorubicin)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set population (FAS). For each parameter, only participants with a value at both baseline and post baseline were included in the analysis.

Only descriptive analysis performed.

reported_events.time_frame: From the signing of the informed consent until the last study-related procedure (up to 12 weeks)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Sleep disorder due to general medical condition, insomnia type

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to the early termination of the trial and the fact that only 2 patients were enrolled in the Phase II of the study, the efficacy endpoints of the trial were not addressed (summary statistics were not performed).
